title: Recorded speed data on Myrtle Road, Sheffield

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
I'd like to request any recorded vehicle speed data you hold for Myrtle Road, Sheffield for the past 10 years. This could include data captured by the Vehicle Activated Signs (VAS) or traffic counter devices which are placed on the road on a temporary basis.
Yours faithfully,
Aaron Walters

Thank you for your email.
This inbox is not being monitored over the Christmas period 25 December
2024 to 1 January 2025.
Your email will be picked up when staff return on the 2 January 2025, and
processed according to legal deadlines. This Email, and any attachments,
may contain non-public information and is intended solely for the
individual(s) to whom it is addressed. It may contain sensitive or
protectively marked material and should be handled accordingly. If this
Email has been misdirected, please notify the author immediately. If you
are not the intended recipient you must not disclose, distribute, copy,
print or rely on any of the information contained in it or attached, and
all copies must be deleted immediately. Whilst we take reasonable steps to
try to identify any software viruses, any attachments to this Email may
nevertheless contain viruses which our anti-virus software has failed to
identify. You should therefore carry out your own anti-virus checks before
opening any documents. Sheffield City Council will not accept any
liability for damage caused by computer viruses emanating from any
attachment or other document supplied with this e-mail

Dear Aaron Walters,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Myrtle Road which
we received on 28/12/2024.
As your request is a request for information relating to the environment,
this has been logged as a request under the Environmental Information
Regulations 2004 (EIR) and will be dealt with under the Regulations. The
reference number for your request can be found above.
The Environmental Information Regulations 2004 state that we must respond
to you within 20 working days, by 28/01/2025. Please do not hesitate to
contact us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Please note that from 1^st January 2025, as part of our commitment to
improving services, the council will accept EIR requests via the online
form which can be found here:
[1]Freedom of Information and Environmental Information requests |
Sheffield City Council
Please bookmark this link for future requests.
The online form is linked directly to our systems in the FOI service as
part of our continued improvement to streamline processes.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ

intended solely for the individual(s) to whom it is addressed. It may

Dear Aaron Walters,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Myrtle Road which
we received on 28/12/2024.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
Please see attached:
1. Myrtle Road – column 16 30.04.2024 *
2. Mrytle Road – column 27 22.02.2024*
3. Myrtle Road – column 27 15.12.2022*
4. Gleadless Valley – Myrtle Road VAS Data Comparison which contains data
for column 16 20.11.2022 and for column 27 19.05.2023.
5. Speed survey data Myrtle Road 14.06.2021
6. Speed survey data Myrtle Road 10.10.2024
*means that the data is in its raw format, and you will need to use an
application which can open .dat files. [1]Software - Houston Radar can be
used and is free to download.
Please note, the names of third parties have been redacted under
Regulation 12(3) of the Environmental Information Regulations 2004 (EIR)
and Regulation 13 EIR as amended by Sch. 19, para 307 of the Data
Protection Act 2018, which provide an exception for where the information
requested includes personal data of which the applicant is not the data
subject where disclosure would contravene the data protection principles
of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). Disclosure of the
information would contravene the data protection principle under Article
5(1)(a) of the General Data Protection Regulation that processing of
personal data must be fair, lawful and transparent.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [2]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[3]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
